comments:
I am trying to get to grips with the new CDT M9 and I am finding it very hard 
going. After about 2 hours of configuring build paths I finally got the 
following exception and the workspaces now refuses to start up:

java.lang.StackOverflowError
	at java.util.AbstractList$Itr.next(AbstractList.java:422)
	at 
org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.parser.pst.ContainerSymbol$ContentsIterator.hasNex
t(ContainerSymbol.java:1060)
	at 
org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.parser.pst.TemplateSymbol.getTemplatedSymbol
(TemplateSymbol.java:49)
	at 
org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.parser.pst.ParserSymbolTable.lookupInParents
(ParserSymbolTable.java:661)
	at 
org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.parser.pst.ParserSymbolTable.lookupInParents
(ParserSymbolTable.java:672)
	at 
org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.parser.pst.ParserSymbolTable.lookupInParents
(ParserSymbolTable.java:672)
	at 
org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.parser.pst.ParserSymbolTable.lookupInParents
(ParserSymbolTable.java:672)
	at 
org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.parser.pst.ParserSymbolTable.lookupInParents
(ParserSymbolTable.java:672)

Do you have the entire stack trace? 
Any idea as to which source file is causing the trace? 
Assigning to Andrew as this is his area of responsibility.

the stack trace continues with 

org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.parser.pst.ParserSymbolTable.lookupInParents
(ParserSymbolTable.java:672)

forever.
I have no idea which file is causing this although I wasn't looking at any 
particular file. I was just trying to configure my include path.

I fixed a problem with defered instantiation so the symbol table can now 
correctly handle the above case.  The 2nd A now correctly inherits from the 1st 
and the 3rd from the 2nd.
I also modified the guard to properly detect real circular inheritance with 
templates.
